image.altText: Founder of Wagner private mercenary group Yevgeny Prigozhin in military gear.

items.synopsis: Ten people died after a private jet crashed in Russia's Tver region north of Moscow, Russia's TASS news agency reports.

title.children: Wagner chief Prigozhin was on plane that crashed with no survivors, say Russian authorities

image.altText: Smoke arises from the site of a jet crash near Moscow.

items.synopsis: Warlord Yevgeny Prigozhin was on the passenger list for a private jet that crashed between Moscow and St Petersburg, Russian state media is reporting.

title.children: Prigozhin 'died as a result of the actions of traitors to Russia' says Wagner group, confirming plane crash

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Russia's Civil Aviation Authority says Wagner PMG leader Yevgeny Prigozhin was on the passenger list of a plane that crashed earlier today. The authority also said Wagner commander Dmitry Utkin died in the crash.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Russian Civil Aviation Authority says Prigozhin was on plane

children.content: Russia's Civil Aviation Authority says Wagner PMG leader Yevgeny Prigozhin was on the passenger list of a plane that crashed earlier today.
The authority also said Wagner commander Dmitry Utkin died in the crash.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: This is what we're dealing with. This image first appeared on social media and has since been verified by news wire service Reuters. Russian state media has been reporting there were no survivors, but the exact number of people on board remains unclear.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: First image of the crash

children.content: This is what we're dealing with.
This image first appeared on social media and has since been verified by news wire service Reuters.
Russian state media has been reporting there were no survivors, but the exact number of people on board remains unclear.

props.alt: A large amount of fire and smoke in a field.

children.content: The wreckage of a jet can be seen in Russia’s Tver region.

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt sitting and smiling

items.synopsis: Police arrived to find a 58-year-old man dead inside an Arundel home yesterday. It is  understood the deceased man was stepfather to the councillor.

title.children: Gold Coast councillor Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden charged with murder of his stepfather

image.altText: Close-up of platypus

items.synopsis: The charity is the latest to confirm its supporters' personal information has been compromised after a Brisbane-based telemarketer was hacked by cybercriminals.

title.children: 'We trusted Pareto': Australian Conservation Foundation confirms 13,500 donors caught up in Pareto Phone data breach

image.altText: Firefiighters battling a blaze.

items.synopsis: An emergency declaration remains in place after four houses are involved in a major blaze in Brisbane's inner south.

title.children: Two houses destroyed in major blaze in Brisbane's inner south

image.altText: A young blonde, white woman smiling in a clasroom

items.synopsis: The results from a brand new NAPLAN system show one in three students are not meeting minimum numeracy and literacy expectations. Experts say one solution lies with the teaching methods.

title.children: This school is defying the NAPLAN struggles at other schools. Here's how they did it

image.altText: A wide shot of the suburb shows the full develpment among standard homes.

items.synopsis: Like Australia, New Zealand has been battling a housing supply problem. One group of friends came up with their own solution.

title.children: Six NZ friends built a new type of home. Are there lessons for Australians?

image.altText: a plane flying in the sky

items.synopsis: Australia has struggled to attract tourists since the pandemic, but a recent decision by the Australian government blocked a request by Qatar Airways to fly more planes into the country.

title.children: Why isn’t the government 'rolling out the red carpet' for airlines who want more flights into Australia?

image.altText: Chalmers points in front of his face. He's standing in front of flags.

items.synopsis: The Intergenerational Report is an exercise in Treasury crystal ball-gazing 40 years into the future. And wherever you look in the latest release, the common thread is the need to boost productivity, writes David Speers.

title.children: Australia is facing five unstoppable shifts in the economy. The challenge now is to ride the waves

image.altText: A 14 year old girl sits on the ground.

items.synopsis: Elizabeth Russell was a teenager when she felt an unusual, severe pain. It would take 15 years before she knew what it was after being repeatedly dismissed by healthcare workers.

title.children: Why it took 15 years for Elizabeth's 'excruciating pain' to be diagnosed as endometriosis

image.altText: Close up of interior of a mailbox containing inflated condoms, glow sticks, lubricants and fruit.

items.synopsis: When Doug went to talk to his neighbour about quotes for a new fence, he was expecting an amicable discussion. Instead, it was the start of a homophobic campaign of harassment.

title.children: Homophobic slurs, condoms in letterbox: Gay couple says laws failed to protect them

image.altText: Close-up of statue of William Crowther, Tasmanian Premier 1878-1879.

items.synopsis: A statue honouring a former premier who mutilated the body of an Aboriginal man will be taken down in recognition of the hurt he caused Tasmania's Aboriginal community — with advocates saying they hope it is not the last.

title.children: 'A reckoning that's time has come': First colonial-era Australian statue to be torn down

image.altText: Young girl on gymnastic beam

items.synopsis: Five years after denying any evidence of child sexual abuse in the sport, Gymnastics Australia signs on to the scheme to help survivors.

title.children: 'Champagne moment' as Gymnastics Australia opts in to compensate child abuse survivors

image.altText: A yellow car drives around a bend in a road next to the burnt-out remains of buildings

items.synopsis: Two weeks after wildfires ravaged the Hawaiian town of Lahaina, a list of the missing has topped 1,000 people, and investigators fear many of the victims will never be found.

title.children: Are 1,100 people really missing after Maui's fires? Here's what we know

image.altText: A man and woman taking a selfie on a beach.

items.synopsis: Hundreds of protesters marched on Brisbane Parliament on Wednesday calling for tougher sentences for young offenders.

title.children: Husband of woman killed in alleged home invasion calls on parents to 'start making hard decisions'

image.altText: A smiling youngster with fair hair stands outside, proudly displaying three medals.

items.synopsis: Two years ago, 10-year-old Hudson "Huddy" Glubb was told that he may never be able to play sport. Now he's back from Germany with a swag of medals, including gold.

title.children: After the Gold Coast rallied behind him, Huddy returns from the World Dwarf Games a champion

image.altText: Katrina has red hair and wears a blue surgical face mask

items.synopsis: Senate inquiry hears from a renter with cancer, a woman who shares a caravan with no hot water or toilet, and a property investor.

title.children: Tenant with cancer feared she would become homeless while undergoing chemo, inquiry hears

image.altText: A Canadian smokejumper.

items.synopsis: In Canada, thousands of firefighters from all over the world have united to battle the country's 'worst fires in recorded history'.

title.children: Parachutes and baked brie: the crack squad taking on Canada’s raging inferno

image.altText: A sign says 'Brisbane Watch House'.

items.synopsis: The proposed amendments, which run to 57 pages, include a raft of significant proposed changes.

title.children: Queensland to allow police watch houses to be used as youth detention centres, overriding  Human Rights Act

image.altText: India moon lander's view of the moon from space.

items.synopsis: India becomes the first country to land near the Moon's south pole, just days after a Russian spacecraft crashed trying to reach the area.

title.children: 'Witnessing history': India celebrates being first to ever land on south pole of the Moon

image.altText: People gathered around two children giving medical assistance in the dark

items.synopsis: Teenagers rescued from a stranded cable car over a deep ravine describe the moments they thought would be their last, while the owner and operator are arrested.

title.children: 'We thought we would die': Children who survived Pakistan cable car emergency speak out

image.altText: Sergei Surovikin, a bald man wearing a blue military uniform, gestures with his hands as he looks at a colleague

items.synopsis: Russia removes Sergei Surovikin as head of the air force after he vanished from public view during a Wagner mercenary mutiny against the top army brass.

title.children: Russian reports say top General Surovikin removed

image.altText: A collapsed building with bricks everywhere and trees behind it and four rescuers in front.

items.synopsis: Officials say the attack on a southern sea port reduced its capacity by 15 per cent and accused Russia of systematically targeting agricultural exports.

title.children: Russian attack on Ukrainian sea port destroys 13,000 tonnes of grain

image.altText: the outside of a building that is on fire

items.synopsis: The two 13-year-old boys are due to appear before a children's court in October.

title.children: Two 13yo boys charged over Sydney inferno that destroyed heritage-listed building

image.altText: An elderly woman smiling and holding weights in her hands.

items.synopsis: Catherina van der Linden, who is believed to be Australia's oldest living person, will celebrate her 111th birthday this week.

title.children: Catherina is turning 111 years old and still hits the gym up to three times a week

items.synopsis: A grassroots movement is making men connect and talk about the issues they're facing in their lives.

title.children: Giving blokes permission to be 'more vulnerable and raw': what is Men's Table and does it work?

image.altText: Steven Bradbury

items.synopsis: More than two decades after his extraordinary "last man standing" Winter Olympics gold medal, Steven Bradbury has been hailed for his bravery after saving four girls in the Sunshine Coast surf.

title.children: 'Five or six minutes of maximum intensity': Steven Bradbury hailed a hero after saving four people from drowning

image.altText: Police car

items.synopsis: ACT prosecutors have been forced to abandon charges against a man accused of a violent robbery because police officers incorrectly gathered the evidence used to identify him.

title.children: Charges dropped against Canberra man due to 'reckless' mistake in way police gathered evidence

image.altText: Four brumbies standing next to each other

items.synopsis: A Senate committee is being urged to take a stronger stance on reducing wild horse numbers in the Australian Alps.

title.children: Damage done to precious alpine environments by feral horses 'cannot be overstated', Senate inquiry told

image.altText: ABC Managing Director David Anderson

items.synopsis: In a statement, the broadcaster has confirmed his reappointment "to end speculation" about his tenure.

title.children: David Anderson reappointed as ABC managing director for a further five years

image.altText: A man in glasses smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Poochera art gallery owner Robert Miller tells the Supreme Court of South Australia that he was drinking with the two men at the back of his gallery when the pair became drunk and started fighting.

title.children: Eyre Peninsula art gallery owner describes hearing 'groaning' after alleged assault of Peter Hillier
